content.question: A <math alttext="20 microfarad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>μF</mtext></math> capacitor is connected to the terminals of a battery for a long time. The capacitor is then removed from the battery and attached to an <math alttext="3 millihenry" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>mH</mtext></math> inductor. What is the frequency of the oscillations in this <math alttext="L C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>LC</mi></math> circuit?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.4 times 10 to the negative 4 power hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Hz</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.5 times 10 to the negative 3 power hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Hz</mtext></math>

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
